title: DMK government stopped three-phase power supply to farmers: Edappadi Palaniswami
content: When Mr. Palaniswami was the Chief Minister of Tamil Nadu, orders were issued to provide three-phase power supply to farmers to ensure uninterrupted power supply throughout the day.

title: ‘Why don’t you feed them in your house?’ SC asks petitioner over feeding of strays
content: “There is all the space for these animals, no space for humans,” the bench told a petitioner who claimed they were subjected to harassment for feeding community dogs in line with the Animal Birth Control Rules.

title: Sivankutty stands firm on school timings change, slams Kerala Governor for ‘support’ of foot worship
content: Minister says discussions will be held with those opposed to it to explain the rationale and convince them

title: Supreme Court fixes July 31 for hearing pleas for review of 2022 verdict upholding powers of Enforcement Directorate
content: SC Bench adjourned the matter to July 31 after Solicitor General Tushar Mehta, appearing for the Centre, informed the court of his unavailability for hearing on Wednesday

title: CPI(M) moves Madras High Court against removal of party flagpoles from public places
content: The party’s State secretary P. Shanmugam, in his petition, says it is an intolerant idea of democracy to remove poles displaying flags of parties and trade unions which serve as the vanguard of the working class

title: Two lecturers among three arrested for rape of student of Moodabidri college in Bengaluru
content: The incident came to light when the accused allegedly started blackmailing her demanding more sexual favours

title: TDP seeks reforms in electoral roll, transparency measures in letter to ECI
content: Key suggestions include annual third-party audits under the CAG, AI-driven de-duplication, Aadhaar-based EPIC number verification, and enhanced public dashboards for voter grievance tracking

title: Congress targets Jaishankar’s visit to China, Rahul Gandhi says India’s foreign policy is being ‘destroyed’
content: Congress communication chief Jairam Ramesh, issued a statement, questioning Mr Jaishankar’s assertion during his meeting with China’s Vice President Han Zheng on July 14

title: Axiom-4 mission: SpaceX Dragon spacecraft carrying Indian astronaut Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla, crew members return to earth
content: The splash down occurred off the coast of  San Diego 22.5 hours after the Dragon departed from the International Space Station (ISS) on July 14

title: Nimisha Priya execution postponed: Council confirms progress in talks with victim’s family
content: Tomy Thomas, husband of Nimisha, says he is happy to hear about the news of her execution being halted. He thanks the Centre, Kerala govt and ‘all those who had worked together to save her from the gallows’

title: Pune Porsche case: 17-year-old accused to be tried as juvenile
content: On July 15, the Juvenile Justice Board rejected the police’s plea to treat the 17-year-old accused boy as an adult, as per the defence counsel

title: Nimisha Priya’s execution ‘postponed’, say Government sources
content: Nimisha Priya was scheduled to be executed in Houthis-controlled Yemen on July 16, 2025 on charges of murdering her business partner.

title: NCP unit in Kerala faces turmoil as Ajit Pawar group demands resignation of LDF legislators for alleged anti-party activities
content: Praful Patel disqualifies Kerala Forest Minister A.K. Saseendran and Kuttanad MLA Thomas K. Thomas from NCP’s primary membership for six years

title: 'Objectionable' cartoons on PM Modi, RSS: Supreme Court grants protection to cartoonist
content: A bench of Justices Sudhanshu Dhulia and Aravind Kumar, however, cautioned the cartoonist if he continued to share offensive posts on social media, the state was free to take action against him under law

title: Heeding farmers’ demand, Karnataka government drops acquisition of 1,777 acres of agriculture land in Devanahalli taluk for aerospace park
content: However, the government will acquire the land of those farmers, who have volunteered to give up their land, by offering them higher compensation and sops like part of developed land

title: Migrant detentions rekindle Bengali identity politics, trigger new churn ahead of 2026 Bengal polls
content: 2026 Assembly polls heat up as TMC accuses BJP of targeting Bengali migrant workers, reigniting Bengali pride narrative

title: Madras High Court stays order directing Sri Lankan Deputy High Commission to reinstate former employee
content: A Division Bench of Justices R. Subramanian and K. Surender say, it has to be examined whether foreign missions would fall within the definition of ‘industry’ under the Industrial Disputes Act, 1947

title: BSE building in Mumbai gets bomb threat, turns out to be hoax
content: A team of the Mumbai Police and the Bomb Detection and Disposal Squad rushed to the BSE highrise tower and conducted a search, the official said, adding that nothing suspicious was found

title: Supreme Court seeks response from U.P. on plea against QR code directive for eateries along Kanwar Yatra route
content: The top court had last year stayed similar directives issued by Uttar Pradesh, Uttarakhand and Madhya Pradesh that asked eateries along the Kanwar Yatra routes to display the names of their owners and staff

title: Final rites of Saroja Devi will be conducted with full State honours: Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah
content: Her last rites will be performed in her native village Dhashavara in Channapatna taluk of Mandya district on July 15, 2025.

title: Pantheerankavu robbery case: ₹39 lakh found buried in plot
content: Police could earlier recover only ₹55,000 from the accused. The money was found buried in a plot half a km away from the house of the main accused

title: Balasore student death: The story so far
content: After repeated complaints of sexual harassment by the Head of Department were reportedly ignored by the principal and other college authorities, the 20-year-old set herself ablaze. Here’s a timeline of events that followed

title: New gecko species from Assam named after Brahmaputra
content: Unlike most lizards of its kind found across the northeastern part of the country, the Cnemaspis brahmaputra is diurnal

title: Congress leader Ramesh Chennithala raises more questions on Anert solar pump tender
content: Chennithala asks if Power Minister is willing to have a forensic audit of deals undertaken by Agency for New and Renewable Energy Research and Technology in the past five years

title: Tourist dies in paragliding crash near Himachal's Dharamshala
content: Satish took off from Indru Nag Paragliding Site in a tandem flight with a paraglider pilot, but their paraglider crashed after a short distance

title: Hope rises in saving Malayali nurse Nimisha Priya facing execution in Yemen as talks progress
content: Discussions with family of deceased Yemeni national are aimed at reaching a final decision on accepting blood money

title: Telangana refuses to discuss ‘Banakacherla’ project at Revanth-Naidu meeting in New Delhi on July 16
content: Writes a letter to the Centre on July 15 morning reminding Central bodies have already objected to it

title: Old bridge collapses during repair in Gujarat’s Junagadh district, no casualties reported
content: The bridge in Junagadh, which links Keshod to Madhavpur, was under maintenance when the collapse occurred.

title: Bengaluru Student Raped By Physics, Biology Lecturers And Their Friend
content: Two teachers and their friend have been arrested for raping a college student in Bengaluru on multiple occasions and blackmailing her.

title: UK Aristocrat, Her Convicted Rapist Partner Found Guilty Over Newborn's Death
content: A jury on Monday found a British woman from an aristocratic family and her convicted rapist partner guilty of manslaughter after their newborn daughter died while they were living off-grid in freezing temperatures.

title: US-Backed Ceasefire Plan For Gaza Still Under Discussion, But Optimism Fading
content: Israeli and Hamas negotiators have been taking part in the latest round of ceasefire talks in Doha since July 6, discussing a U.S.-backed proposal for a 60-day ceasefire that envisages a phased release of hostages.

title: These Non-Metro Cities Are Attracting More Jobs, Talent In India: Report
content: Job market momentum and economic opportunity are growing in non-metro cities in India, according to a new report on Tuesday.

title: "Another Milestone": PM Modi On Shubhanshu Shukla's Return From Space
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi welcomed Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla, India's first astronaut to have visited the International Space Station, back on earth on Tuesday.

title: A Timeline Of Key Moments As Shubhanshu Shukla Returns From Space
content: The Axiom-4 mission, which marked India's return to human spaceflight after four decades, finally returned to Earth.

title: Shubhanshu Shukla's Homecoming Live Updates: Shux To Return To India On August 17
content: The Axiom-4 crew includes American astronaut Commander Peggy Whitson, Pilot Shubhanshu Shukla, and Mission Specialists Slawosz Uznanski-Wisniewski and Tibor Kapu.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Heroes Don't Always Win. At Lord's, That Was Ravindra Jadeja
content: Team India need to sort out quite a few things in this week-long break before the fourth Test starts in Manchester on July 23. But, the one thing they dont need to think about at all is what Ravindra Jadeja will bring to the table.

title: 14 Million Children Received Not A Single Vaccine In 2024, Says UN
content: More than 14 million children did not receive a single vaccine last year - about the same number as the year before - according to U.N. health officials. Nine countries accounted for more than half of those unprotected children.

title: Tesla India Entry With $70,000 Model Y To Test Musk's Brand Pull
content: Tesla Inc. opened its first India showroom, showcasing Model Y cars priced at nearly $70,000, as Elon Musk's electric-vehicle maker looks to tap new markets and offset slowing sales where it's already well established.

title: Top Maoist Leaders Likely To Surrender In Telangana Today
content: Two prominent Maoist leaders, Atram Lachanna and Atram Aruna, are expected to surrender before the Ramagundam police on Tuesday.

title: Explained: How A Hair Cut In Space Differs From One On Earth
content: Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla has made history by becoming the first Indian to get a haircut in microgravity, while living aboard his home away from home at the International Space Station.

title: 30% US Tariff Would Force Europe To Rethink Export-Led Economic Model
content: The 30% tariff on European goods threatened by US President Donald Trump would, if implemented, be a game-changer for Europe, wiping out whole chunks of transatlantic commerce and forcing a rethink of its export-led economic model.

title: "Everyday When You Came Back Home...": What Killed Israel Soldier's Wife Said
content: The wife of an Israeli soldier, who was killed in Gaza, said every day he'd return from his mission and tell her the number of houses their forces demolished.

title: Parachutes Deployed, Shubhanshu Shukla To Splash Down Near San Diego Soon
content: Shubhanshu Shukla is on his way back from orbiting laboratory, travelling in SpaceX's crew capsule named Grace. It is a 22.5-hour journey and is expected to splash down off the coast of California near San Diego at about 3 PM.

title: Live Updates: Tesla Opens First India Showroom In Mumbai's Bandra Kurla Complex
content: Tesla is a brand of big expectations in the domain of electric mobility for the Indian market. After a long journey, the electric carmaker is made its formal entry to the Indian market on July 15, 2025.

title: Ashwini Vaishnaw Shares 1st "Breakthrough" In Undersea Bullet Train Tunnel
content: The construction of the first 2.7-km stretch of India's ambitious 21-km undersea bullet train tunnel has been completed. Located between Ghansoli and Shilphata, the section is a part of the Mumbai-Ahmedabad High-Speed Rail (MAHSR) corridor.

title: Israeli Ultra-Orthodox Party Quits Netanyahu's Government. Whats At Stake
content: One of Israel's ultra-Orthodox Jewish parties has quit Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's coalition in a long-running dispute over a new military conscription bill. This move leaves Netanyahu's nationalist-religious government extremely vulnerable.

title: Tesla Faces Rough Ride Online As Indians React To Pricing, Road Conditions
content: Tesla has arrived in India, with its first showroom in Mumbai and plans underway for a second outlet in Delhi.

title: 35 IPS officers transferred in Karnataka, Karthik Reddy replaces M. N. Anucheth as Joint Commissioner of Police, Traffic, Bengaluru
content: The government appointed Deputy Commissioners of Police (DCP) for the three newly-created divisions with the Bengaluru police

title: Farmers in Kerala’s Kannur to stage protest against fertilizer price hike, subsidy cuts

title: Kudawala distribute electoral enumeration roll forms to voters in Patna
content: People who have received forms from the Kudawala allege that they did not get any receipt and the form did not bear any bar code on it

title: P.V. Anvar plans Trinamool Congress revamp in Kerala; district meet in Kasaragod on July 19
content: Move comes after his unexpected performance as an Independent candidate in Nilambur byelection where he secured around 20,000 votes

title: Two SpiceJet passengers try to enter cockpit forcefully, offloaded at Delhi airport
content: According to SpiceJet, despite repeated requests by the cabin crew, fellow passengers, and the captain, the two passengers refused to return to their seats

title: Maharashtra to enact anti-conversion law in December, will be stricter than other States: Minister
content: Rajasthan, Uttar Pradesh, Madhya Pradesh, Odisha, Andhra Pradesh, Chhattisgarh, Gujarat, Himachal Pradesh, Jharkhand and Uttarakhand have their own anti-conversion law

title: Kerala CM arrives in State after treatment in U.S.
content: Kerala Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan returns from U.S. after medical care, received by top officials at airport

title: PFI’s plea against ban not maintainable: Centre
content: The PFI challenged the March 21, 2024 order of the Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act tribunal confirming the decision by the Centre on September 27, 2022

title: Transition must be completed within a fixed timeframe, no room for negligence, says Yogi on school merger

title: Priyanka questions U.P. school merger decision, calls it directed against Dalits, backwards

content: Opposition has welcomed this move and raised concerns around the modus operandi of drug peddlers involving minors

title: Complaint filed against MNS chief Raj Thackeray for “provocative” remarks

title: Campus Mothers to supplement professionals, not replace them: IIT Kharagpur Director
content: The new ‘Campus Mothers’ student welfare initiative, seeking to enlist female volunteers to offer informal emotional support to students, was criticised by mental health professionals for being “gendered”

content: The Dragon, which is carrying the Ax-4 crew, will also announce its arrival with a brief sonic boom prior to splashing down

title: Indian Institute of Space Science and Technology researchers gear up to study seeds that were sent to space
content: Seeds of Jyothi and Uma rice varieties, Kanakamani (horse gram), Vellayani Vijay (tomato), Thilakathara (sesame) and Soorya (brinjal/eggplant) were sent to the ISS under the ‘Crop Seeds on ISS’, a project spearheaded by the IIST’s Space Biology Lab.

title: Kaziranga records high diversity of grassland bird species
content: A team of forest officials, bird experts, scientists, and conservationists recorded 43 grassland species across Kaziranga’s three wildlife divisions

title: In a first, President Murmu sanctions grant for Eklavya school toppers
content: Officials say that the NESTS had disbursed ₹62.40 lakh of this discretionary fund to 823 meritorious students who have secured the highest marks in their respective streams

title: Central Railway submits action plan on track safety to Bombay High Court
content: It informs court that the Mumbra accident probe is under review, while responding to a petition on railway commuter safety

title: A.P. CM launches portal to make drone services accessible to commoners

title: Odisha girl who self-immolated on college campus dies

title: West Bengal has fared better than national average on various socio-economic indicators: Mamata
content: Citing a NITI Aayog report, the West Bengal Chief Minister says the State fared better in areas such as employment, sex ratio and infant mortality rate, and adds that these achievements reflect the State government’s ‘continued commitment to inclusive and sustainable development’

title: BJP MP Ravi Shankar Prasad speaks to top police officers over increasing crime in Patna

title: DRDL-AIIMS Bibinagar unveil low-cost, advanced carbon fibre foot prosthesis
content: It is expected to reduce the cost significantly to as low as less than ₹20,000 in production in comparison to the cost of the current imported similar products that are priced around ₹2 lakh

title: Tasmac increases salaries of workers, penalises those fleecing customers

content: In his condolence message, Mr. Ravi said her timeless contributions shaped a golden era of film and continue to resonate across generations

title: Death of children due to rabies points to need for pre-exposure prophylaxis vaccination

title: Dumper's Derby: Raleigh first C to take HR crown

title: Report: Sternberg to sell Rays for $1.7 billion
content: Stu Sternberg has agreed in principle to a $1.7 billion deal to sell the Rays to a group led by a Florida-based developer Patrick Zalupski.

title: Miz on All-Star critics: 'They're not upset with me'

title: Sirianni rips narrative that Eagles carried Hurts

content: Klay Thompson's trip to the Bahamas led to the usual offseason vacation social media collage . rumors about the rapper's relationship started swirling after the rapper posted a photo on Instagram . in one slide, the rapper posed alongside someone, presumed to be Pete, facing away from the camera .

title: Nimisha Priya execution stay: Sunni leader Kanthapuram’s intervention pays off
content: e-Paper The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective . first day first show news and reviews from the world of cinema and streaming . the weekly newsletter from science writers takes the jargon out of science and puts the fun in!

title: Christian McCaffrey and Olivia Culpo announce birth of first child with joint post
content: Christian McCaffrey  and Olivia Culpo welcomed their first child. The  San Francisco 49ers  star running back and former Miss Universe announced the news in a joint Instagram post on Sunday. The black-and-white photo collage included images of the couple in the delivery room as well each of them cradling their baby. McCaffrey and Culpo  announced in March  that they were expecting. A post shared by Olivia Frances Culpo (@oliviaculpo) "Colette Annalise McCaffrey" the couple wrote together on Instagram. Culpo posted a photo of McCaffrey with their baby on her Instagram story, captioning it: "Colette is so lucky to have the best daddy in the world. A love like no other." She also added a photo of McCaffrey consoling Culpo while in the delivery room, writing: "The scariest and most rewarding of all experiences. As soon as he came into the room I felt most at peace." McCaffrey and Culpo  married in June 2024 .

title: Distribution of eggs, bananas not regular in over 560 schools in Karnataka, finds inspection report
content: e-Paper The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective . first day first show news and reviews from the world of cinema and streaming . the weekly newsletter from science writers takes the jargon out of science and puts the fun in!

title: Fighters grades: One A, one F, and a lot in between after a weekend full of boxing
content: undisputed junior welterweight champion Katie Taylor wins by majority decision to remain unbeaten in their fight trilogy . it was a brilliant performance by Taylor, who decided to slow down the pace to keep Serrano guessing and out of range .

title: Shakur Stevenson showed that the fight in him is second to none
content: Shakur Stevenson beats William Zepeda to retain his WBC lightweight title . he was promoted to the co-main event of Ring Magazine 3 by Turki Alalshikh . the chairman of Saudi Arabia's general entertainment authority was elevated to the main event .

title: Who are the NFL's best quarterbacks? Execs, coaches and scouts help rank 2025's top 10
content: ESPN surveyed league executives, coaches and scouts to help us rank the top 10 players at 11 different positions, from quarterback to cornerback and all positions in between . in total, more than 70 voters submitted a ballot on at least one position, and in many cases all positions .

title: YouTuber Samay Raina appears before NCW over remarks on 'India's Got Latent'
content: e-Paper The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective . first day first show news and reviews from the world of cinema and streaming . the weekly newsletter from science writers takes the jargon out of science and puts the fun in!

title: Why PSG shouldn't dwell too much on Club World Cup rout by Chelsea
content: PSG lost 3-0 to Chelsea in the club world cup final . they went on a tear that saw them win 17 of their next 19 games . coach Luis Enrique turned them into a near-flawless football machine .

title: 'Inspired a billion dreams': PM Modi hails Shubhanshu Shukla's 'courage'
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi celebrated Shubhanshu Shukla's return to Earth after his historic mission to the International Space Station, marking a significant milestone for India's space program. Union Minister Jitendra Singh also hailed Shukla's successful voyage as a moment of pride and glory for India. Shukla returned safely aboard the Dragon capsule, carrying valuable cargo and experiments.

title: Rishabh Pant's pain: Run-out controversy, 9 runs, and emotional message
content: England clinched a narrow 22-run victory over India in a thrilling third Test at Lord's, taking a 2-1 series lead. Despite a late resistance from Jadeja and Siraj, India fell short of the 193-run target. Gill highlighted Pant's earlier run-out as a crucial turning point, impacting India's potential first-innings lead and ultimately contributing to the defeat.

title: Tesla India launch: Anand Mahindra's message to Elon Musk; says ‘Meet you at …’
content: Anand Mahindra welcomed Elon Musk and Tesla to India as the EV company officially debuted with its first showroom, the Tesla Experience Centre, in Mumbai. Mahindra expressed optimism and acknowledged the competition Tesla brings to India's growing EV sector. Tesla has launched its Model Y in India, with prices starting at Rs 61 lakh.

title: 'Designed to ride elevators, board trains': China deploys robots for delivery
content: Shenzhen has launched a pioneering initiative using autonomous robots to restock 7-Eleven stores within its subway system. Operated by VX Logistics, these robots navigate elevators, platforms, and trains during off-peak hours to deliver goods. This innovative system aims to alleviate logistical challenges for store staff, replacing manual deliveries.

title: 'Can you hit Moscow?' Trump asks Zelenskyy to strike deep inside Russia
content: In a notable shift, Donald Trump reportedly urged Volodymyr Zelenskyy to intensify strikes within Russia, even inquiring about Ukraine's capacity to hit Moscow and St. Petersburg with the right weaponry. This conversation, following a tense exchange with Vladimir Putin, signals growing US frustration with Russia's refusal to negotiate and a potential move towards more aggressive tactics to pressure the Kremlin.

title: India’s June trade deficit narrows to $18.78 billion, services surplus stays stron
content: India's merchandise trade deficit narrowed to $18.78 billion in June, surpassing market forecasts and improving from May's figures, driven by decreased exports and imports. Merchandise exports reached $35.14 billion, while imports totaled $53.92 billion. The services sector contributed a strong surplus of $15.62 billion, with exports at $32.84 billion and imports at $17.58 billion.

title: 'We will revoke your US visa and deport you if you do not ...': US Embassy in India
content: The US Embassy in India has issued a stern warning to visa holders, emphasizing that scrutiny continues even after visa issuance. Authorities continuously monitor compliance with US laws and immigration rules, with potential consequences including visa revocation and deportation for violations.

title: Kerala nurse death row: Big relief for Nimisha Priya in Yemen; execution postponed
content: Yemeni authorities have delayed the execution of Nimisha Priya, a Kerala nurse convicted of murder, originally scheduled for July 16. The Indian government has increased its efforts to allow Priya's family more time to negotiate a resolution with the victim's family. Priya was convicted in 2020 for the murder of her business partner.

title: Pune Porsche crash case: 17-year-old accused to be tried as minor; JJB rejects police plea
content: The Juvenile Justice Board (JJB) has denied the Pune Police's request to try a 17-year-old involved in a fatal Porsche crash as an adult. The teenager, accused of driving under the influence and causing the death of two IT professionals in May 2024, will remain under the juvenile justice system.

title: History repeats? Bashir to Siraj feels like Mushtaq to Srinath
content: Anil Kumble lauded the thrilling Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy despite India's narrow loss at Lord's, emphasizing the series' compelling nature. He highlighted the fine margins that decided the match, such as Pant's run-out and extras conceded.

title: AI war: Zuckerberg ups the ante; offers Rs 1,600cr to Apple AI exec; here's who he is
content: Mark Zuckerberg is building a Superintelligence Lab, offering record-breaking salaries up to Rs 1,600 crore to attract top AI talent from companies like Apple, OpenAI, and Google DeepMind. This initiative aims to unify Meta's AI projects and accelerate the development of superintelligence, surpassing artificial general intelligence. Meta's aggressive recruitment signals an intensified AI talent war in Silicon Valley.

title: ‘Illegal sanctions…’: China hits out at Trump’s tariff threat for Russia allies
content: China has strongly condemned Donald Trump's threat of imposing tariffs on Russia's allies, labeling it as 'illegal, unilateral sanctions' and 'coercion.' Trump's ultimatum demands an end to the Ukraine conflict within 50 days, threatening 100% tariffs on nations trading with Russia.

title: Rahul's dig at Jaishankar 'apprising' China's Xi; calls it 'full-blown circus'
content: Rahul Gandhi criticized External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar for briefing Chinese President Xi Jinping on India-China relations, calling it a "full-blown circus." Jaishankar met with Xi and other Chinese officials to discuss bilateral ties, emphasizing mutual respect and addressing border issues. He also conveyed greetings from Indian leaders and expressed optimism for improved relations.

title: IND vs ENG: England recall 35-year-old spinner; Shoaib Bashir ruled out
content: Liam Dawson makes a comeback to the England Test team. He replaces Shoaib Bashir, who is injured. Bashir broke his finger during the third Test against India. England currently leads the five-match series 2-1. The fourth Test match will be held in Manchester. Gus Atkinson is also likely to return to the team.

title: NHL trade buzz: McDavid weighs Oilers loyalty; eyes free agency freedom
content: Elliotte Friedman suggests Connor McDavid is likely to sign a contract extension with the Edmonton Oilers, securing his future with the team beyond the 2025-26 season. Despite recent playoff heartbreaks and speculation about McDavid exploring free agency, the Oilers' captain seems committed to chasing a Stanley Cup in Edmonton. Negotiations for a lucrative contract extension are expected.

title: What happened to Eugenia Cooney after being AWOL in a livestream?
content: After a worrying live stream in May 2025, Eugenia Cooney has sparked a speculation of a death hoax, after she went radio silent, aided by a Meta AI summary and an alleged claim by a neighbour. However, there have been no any official confirmations, and fans are cautioned not to spread speculation and to wait until there is an actual update.

title: Eugenia Cooney death rumor resurfaces, AI content fueling up confusion
content: Social media is abuzz with rumors of Eugenia Cooney's death, fueled by AI-generated content and unverified claims. A Meta AI summary falsely stated her passing, while a TikTok user claiming to be a neighbor alleged witnessing an ambulance at her residence. However, fans express skepticism, citing the lack of credible sources and Cooney's history of social media breaks.

title: Kerala woman, toddler found dead in UAE; suicide note posted on social media
content: Kundara Police filed cases against Nitheesh, Neethu, and Mohanan. They are accused of abetting the suicide of Vipanchika and her daughter in Sharjah. Vipanchika's family alleges dowry harassment and abuse. A suicide note detailing the torture surfaced online. The family demands repatriation of the bodies and a thorough postmortem.

title: Cricket: 'One can't be fooled for 5 years', Allahabad HC stays arrest of Yash Dayal over sexual exploitation allegations
content: The Allahabad High Court has granted cricketer Yash Dayal interim protection from arrest in a sexual exploitation case. Dayal is accused of exploiting a woman for five years under the false pretence of marriage. The court questioned the complainant's claim of being deceived for such an extended period, providing Dayal relief until the next hearing.

title: Bullet train project on track! Japan’s E10 trains to run on Mum-Ahmedabad route
content: India's first bullet train project will deploy Japan's advanced E10 Shinkansen trains, slated to debut in 2030, on the Mumbai-Ahmedabad route. While construction progresses with Japanese Shinkansen technology, Indian Railways is also exploring European and domestic partnerships for signalling systems and indigenous train manufacturing, aiming for commercial services by 2027.

title: CoryxKenshin scandal: Ex accuses YouTuber of abuse, manipulation on TikTok
content: Popular YouTuber CoryxKenshin faces serious allegations from TikTok user @pandaninjaxxofficial, who detailed a harmful relationship involving emotional abuse and manipulation. The accusations include disturbing audio clips and screenshots of messages, sparking outrage online. @pandaninjaxxofficial described feeling emotionally discarded and used, while CoryxKenshin has yet to release an official statement, leaving fans in disbelief and demanding answers.

title: India's Got Latent row: Comedian Samay Raina appears in SC; court asks him, others to file response
content: Samay Raina, Balraj, and Nishant Tanwar appeared before the Supreme Court. A petition accused them of derogatory remarks about disabled persons. The court directed them to file written replies. They must appear in person at the next hearing. The case involves an episode of India’s Got Latent. It sparked debate over free speech and responsibility.

title: Telangana bets big on experiential learning, but SEL falls behind: What students are losing out on
content: Telangana is leading the shift toward experiential learning, embedding activity-based education across its schools, reveals the PARAKH report. However, the state’s progress is undercut by significant gaps in Social-Emotional Learning (SEL), with data exposing emotional disconnect among students and teachers. Experts warn this imbalance could hinder the goal of holistic, future-ready education.

title: 'Provides no answers': Global Pilots' body questions AI 171 report; warns against 'hasty conclusions'
content: Following the preliminary report on the Air India AI 171 crash in Ahmedabad, IFALPA cautioned against "hasty conclusions," echoing concerns about a suicide theory. The ICPA has also strongly condemned the "reckless and unfounded insinuation of pilot suicide" circulating after the report's release.

title: Nate Munzer, a junior U18 player, punched by Grade A adult footballer
content: Bronte Joel Munzer, father of junior U18 player Nate, has publicly criticized the one-game suspension given to an adult footballer who punched his son in the throat during a match on June 28, 2025. Munzer highlighted the severity of the incident, where Nate was left breathless and with a throat infection.

title: Actor and producer Dheeraj Kumar passes away at the age of 79
content: Veteran actor and producer Dheeraj Kumar passed away today at 79, succumbing to pneumonia after being hospitalised in Mumbai. Known for his roles in Punjabi and Hindi films like 'Swami' and his production house Creative Eye, famed for 'Om Namah Shivay', his demise has deeply saddened the entertainment industry.

title: Watch: Vaibhav Suryavanshi creates bowling record in IND U19 vs ENG U19 - details
content: 14-year-old Vaibhav Suryavanshi added to his batting records at the U-19 level. Having already made a mark and collected multiple batting milestones in England, he got on the scorecard with the ball as well. After Day 3, India U19 team lead the unofficial Test by 229 runs at the Kent County Cricket Ground.

title: Odisha self-immolation case: Rahul blames 'BJP’s system'; Pradhan calls it ‘petty politics’
content: A political controversy has erupted in Odisha following the death of a college student who attempted self-immolation due to alleged sexual harassment. Opposition parties, including Congress and BJD, have criticized the "BJP system," while the BJP has accused them of engaging in "cheap politics.

title: Who was Fauja Singh? The 114-year-old, nicknamed 'Turbaned Tornado', killed in hit-and-run
content: Fauja Singh, the "Turbaned Tornado" and world's oldest marathon runner, tragically passed away at 114 after being struck by a car in his native Punjab. He began his running journey at 89, achieving numerous age-group records, including becoming the first centenarian to complete a marathon.

title: 'Fueling Putin's war machine': Will India, China face tariff heat over Russian oil?
content: US Senators Graham and Blumenthal are pushing for sanctions on countries like India, China, and Brazil for trading with Russia, potentially imposing tariffs up to 500%.  This comes at a time when US President Trump has announced that he will impose 100 percent "secondary tariffs" on Russia if President Vladimir Putin does not agree to end the war in Ukraine within 50 days.

title: Fact check: Aussie umpire in focus after 'anti-India' bias; India lose third Test
content: Former India cricketers R Ashwin and Anil Kumble voiced concerns regarding umpire Paul Reiffel's decisions during the Lord's Test, hinting at potential bias against India. Several controversial calls, including those involving Joe Root and Shubman Gill, sparked debate. Despite these concerns, statistical analysis reveals that in matches officiated by Reiffel, India has a win percentage of 58.

title: TCS gives out variable pay! Over 70% employees to get 100% variable
content: TCS will provide 100% variable pay to approximately 70% of its employees for the April-June quarter, while compensation for the remaining staff will depend on business unit performance. Despite this payout, the annual salary hike policy is still pending amidst economic challenges and revenue decline.

title: Dragon capsule splashdown today: Shubhanshu Shukla's mother recites Sundarkand
content: Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla, India's second astronaut, is set to return to Earth at 3:01 pm IST after a historic 20-day mission aboard the ISS as part of Axiom-4. His family in Lucknow is filled with excitement and prayers, eagerly awaiting his arrival. During his mission, Shukla completed over 310 orbits and traveled over 1.

title: 1st meeting since 2020: Jaishankar meets Xi; updates him on recent development in bilateral ties
content: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar's visit to China marked a significant step in improving relations after years of border tensions. He met with President Xi Jinping and Wang Yi, discussing bilateral ties, border issues, and trade concerns. Both sides emphasized mutual respect and the importance of stable relations, with discussions also covering terrorism, trans-border rivers, and people-to-people exchanges.

title: Pahalgam terror attack: Pakistan political, military brass ordered hit; ISI gave 'directions' to LeT
content: Sources indicate the Pahalgam terror attack, which resulted in 26 civilian deaths, was orchestrated by Pakistan's ISI and Lashkar-e-Taiba, with approval from Pakistani political and military leaders. The operation, executed solely by Pakistani terrorists, was led by Sulaiman, a suspected former Pakistani special forces commando.

title: Gold vs Silver: Yellow metal delivers smart returns; but here’s why silver is outperforming
content: While gold has seen steady gains due to global uncertainties, silver has significantly outperformed it recently, with a nearly 20% increase since April 1st. This surge is fueled by silver's extensive industrial applications, particularly in rapidly growing sectors like solar panels and electric vehicles.

title: India-US trade deal: Why Indian importers are delaying clearance of American dry fruits?
content: As India and the US negotiate a trade agreement before US President Trump's tariff deadline, Indian dry fruit importers are delaying customs clearances for US walnuts and almonds. Anticipating a significant reduction in import duties, potentially around 50%, importers are willing to pay penalties for delayed clearance to avoid financial losses if duties decrease after goods are cleared at current rates.

title: Tesla enters India: 1st showroom to be launched in Mumbai; pricing details out
content: Tesla is officially entering the Indian market, launching its first showroom in Mumbai's Maker Maxity Mall. The EV giant has revealed the on-road price of the Model Y at Rs 61 lakh, with the rear-wheel drive variant priced at Rs 59.89 lakh.

title: Lokesh Kanagaraj reacts to Sanjay Dutt’s Thalapathy Vijay’s Leo remark
content: Lokesh Kanagaraj addressed the recent remarks made by Bollywood actor Sanjay Dutt regarding his role in the Thalapathy Vijay starrer Leo. Sanjay Dutt shared that he was disappointed when Lokesh gave him a small role in the film, and he felt it was wasted in a humorous way.

title: Why do 97% of Delhi schools offer art activities, but only 42% teach job-ready skill?
content: The PARAKH 2024 report highlights a crucial gap in Delhi's education system. While schools excel in experiential learning and cultural activities, skill-based education remains limited, reaching only 42% of schools. Despite high student demand, the lack of adequate skill training infrastructure and integration into the mainstream curriculum poses a significant challenge to preparing students for the future job market.

title: TNPSC group 2 recruitment 2025: Notification released for CCS exam - check here
content: Tamil Nadu Public Service Commission has announced the Group 2 and 2A Combined Civil Services Examination–II for 2025. The recruitment drive aims to fill 645 vacancies across various government departments. The selection process involves preliminary and main exams. Group 2 includes an interview stage. Group 2A selection is based on written exams.

title: Mumbai: Driver rams into pregnant woman; 18-year-old booked for rash driving
content: An 18-year-old student, Vyom Poddar, has been booked by Malabar Hill police after his car collided with a Mercedes in the Coastal Road tunnel on Sunday night. The Mercedes was occupied by a 33-year-old pregnant businesswoman, Sonam Bhabhani, and her husband. Bhabhani, a Bandra resident, sustained injuries to her leg, face, head, and back and was briefly hospitalized.

title: Can Brian Kelly and LSU win it all?
content: coach Brian Kelly has worked at lSU for more than 35 years . he will join Nick Saban, Les Miles and Ed Orgeron as a national champion . the team has a unique focus taking hold in the weight room .

title: Euro 2025 Daily: England thrash Wales and avoid Germany, Spain in bracket
content: the 2025 women's european championship is into the final group games . we will update this file throughout each matchday with the latest reporting, analysis and fun from the competition . for roughly a third of the match, it appeared England were going to top the group (as France were losing 2-1)

title: New rules for EBUGs? 84 games? What to know about the NHL's new CBA
content: the current CBA runs through the end of the 2025-26 season . the new CBA is set to begin on sept. 16, 2026 and runs through Sept. 15, 2030 . it would make the fastest both sides have reached an extension in Gary Bettman's tenure .

title: Takeaways from the Home Run Derby in Atlanta
content: Cal Raleigh becomes the first catcher to win the 2025 home run Derby . the Seattle Mariners slugger outlasted junior Caminero . it was a power-packed night in Atlanta as oneil Cruz hit a ball a whopping 513 feet .

title: Repairs to Masab Tank flyover slows down traffic
content: e-Paper The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective . the weekly newsletter from science writers takes the jargon out of science and puts the fun in . traffic jams have become a daily occurrence on the Masab Tank flyover .

title: 2026 recruiting class rankings: Where LSU fits after landing Lamar Brown
content: no. 1 overall prospect Lamar Brown commits to play for the LSU Tigers . 15 of the teams in the current top 25 secured at least one ESPN 300 commitment . Alabama is on the rise by adding multiple four-star (or better) prospects .

title: Favorite (and surprising) Day 1 MLB draft picks -- and Day 2's top names
content: the nationals select shortstop Eli Willits with the first overall pick of the 2025 MLB draft . it's time to look at which picks in the first round stood out most . some of the picks we aren't quite sure about on Day 1 will become clearer .

title: 2025 MLB draft tracker: Day 2 pick-by-pick results and Day 1 analysis
content: all 20 rounds of the 2025 MLB draft are in the books . the Washington Nationals select shortstop Eli Willits with the no. 1 overall pick . college pitcher Tyler Bremner and the Seattle Mariners nabbed another in Kade Anderson .

title: Kanwar diktat: SC issues notice to UP govt; row over asking eateries to display names of owners
content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics .

title: Back on Earth: Astronaut Shubhanshu Shukla's epic splashdown near San Diego; watch video
content: the TOI News Desk is your trusted source for staying informed and connected to the ever-evolving global landscape . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics .

title: Shux, Ax-4 exit Grace - here’s how recovery happened
content: As a young democracy grows out of adolescence, its rolling out reels and reels of tales. If the first post office or a telephone connection paints one colour, the Stamp of a stock market scam or the ‘Jewel Thieves’ scandal paint yet another colour. If failure of a sounding rocket was a stepping stone, sending 104 satellites in one go was a podium. If farmer suicides are a bad climax, growing number of Unicorns are a grand entry. Chethan Kumar, Senior Assistant Editor, The Times of India, who alternates between the mundane goings-on of the hoi polloi and the wonder-filled worlds of scientists and scamsters, politicians and Jawans, feels: There’s always a story, one just has to find it. Read More
